course_format: Duration of the course is 24 academic hours. (3 full days).
The course includes approximately 40% hands on lab work.
objectives: To be able to write programs in Rust.
To master the rich set of Rust libraries (crates).
prerequisites: Basic programming background in either a high-level language such as C, Java or a scripting language such as Shell, VBSscript, Javascript, Perl, PHP or Ruby

entries: Cargo - the package and dependency manager of Rust
Understanding memory safety, ownership and borrowing
Distributing executables for multiple platforms (CI/CD, cross compilation)
syllabus.title: Rust

entries: Data embedded in the source code
Manual memory managemen with allocation and freeing
Statically type vs. dynamically typed languages
syllabus.title: Relevant Computer Science topics
CLI - Command line applications in Rust
Unsafe Rust and FFI - Foreign Function Interface

target_audience: This is a beginner course suitable for anyone wanting to use Rust for developing libraries or applications.
title: Rust Programming
